document_data.name: Yaqub al-Quwwat
document_data.mainbody: Sheikh '''Yaqub al-Quwwat''' was the young leader of the [[House of Dubb]] tribe in the [[High Desert]] of [[west Zakhara]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38">
document_data.Description: Yaqub was tall and powerful. He was a prideful man who wished he commanded an army as opposed to a tribe of desert-dwellers.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
document_data.Activities: Adventure was the foremost priority for Yaqub. He would not hesitant to drop everything in favor of roaming the land on hunting trips with his favorite companions.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
document_data.Relationships: Yaqub developed a severe attraction for [[Ajayib]]'s Caliph [[Halima al-Wahsi]]. As Yaqub had no wife or children, he was driven by his attraction to the Caliph. However, his [[kahin]] predicted he would die alone.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
